titleStmt.title: The golden Aphroditis a pleasant discourse, penned by Iohn Grange Gentleman, student in the common lavve of Englande. Wherevnto be annexed by the same authour asvvell certayne metres vpon sundry poyntes, as also diuers pamphlets in prose, which he entituleth his Garden: pleasant to the eare, and delightful to the reader, if he abuse not the scente of the floures.
titleStmt.author: Grange, John, fl. 1577.

titleStmt.title: The golden Aphroditis a pleasant discourse, penned by Iohn Grange Gentleman, student in the common lavve of Englande. Wherevnto be annexed by the same authour asvvell certayne metres vpon sundry poyntes, as also diuers pamphlets in prose, which he entituleth his Garden: pleasant to the eare, and delightful to the reader, if he abuse not the scente of the floures.
titleStmt.author: Grange, John, fl. 1577.

notesStmt.note: "Granges garden" has divisional title page; register is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
